Add YouTube channel names to allow them to bypass blocking. Enter the exact channel name as it appears on the short at the bottom of the screen. Short views and swipes are still tracked and counted for allowlisted channels, but while you are watching allowlisted channels you will not be kicked out of shorts.

No More Shorts needs special accessibility permissions to help you control your YouTube Shorts usage.

• We monitor your screen to detect when you're watching YouTube Shorts
• We automatically close Shorts when you've reached your set limits
• We can press the back button for you to exit Shorts

Your privacy is protected:
• No data leaves your device
• We only look at YouTube's interface, not your personal content
• Only your app settings are saved on your device

How to enable:
1. Click the button below to open accessibility settings
2. Navigate to "Downloaded apps" or "Installed apps"
3. Find and tap "NoMoreShorts"
4. Toggle the switch to enable it

Without these permissions, the app cannot function.

No More Shorts cannot function without accessibility permissions. These permissions allow us to detect YouTube Shorts and help you stick to your usage limits.\n\nPlease grant the permission to continue using the app.
